New Records: Freddie Freeman launched the first walk-off grand slam in the history of the Fall Classic.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam in Game 1.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a go-ahead two-run homer in the sixth inning of Game 1.
Tommy Edman won NLCS MVP and had a two-hit Game 1 in the Fall Classic.
Shohei Ohtani continued his strong postseason run with a double and a run in Game 1.
Pre-Game Insights: Anthony Volpe expressed confidence in the Yankees' ability to bounce back after the Game 1 loss.
Carlos Rodón emphasized his confidence in his abilities and adjustments made during the postseason.
The Dodgers are confident after their Game 1 win, with Freddie Freeman highlighting the importance of the victory.
Yankees are trying to avoid losing the first two games on the road, which historically leads to a low chance of winning the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees have won eight of the previous 11 World Series meetings between the clubs.
The Dodgers and Yankees had a World Series preview in June, with Los Angeles winning two of the three games.
